reviews.review: great game with an awesome concept. love these guys

Starting off on this game is tough on both killers and survivors for a multitude of reasons and considering how long the game has been out and how little the devs have done to discourage these things or balance the game for newer players imma suggest not buying the game. Why do I say this? well i'm just gonna list off a few reasons. Survivor: You have to depend on other players to escape who are more than likely also new to the game meaning in most matches you're gonna die on your first encounter with a killer or better yet get farmed for bloodpoints, most killers will also be new to the game meaning getting tunneled and facecamped on hooks to ensure they get kills and these actions goes unpunished by the devs
Killer: the ranking system doesn't seem to work or maybe there just isn't an even amount of people playing killer or survivor so more than likely you as a new player who barely knows the mechanics of the game will be paired against survive with friends groups or Rank Iridescent 4's which btw is elite players that most of the time have 1 year plus time in the game (and yes this does happen for the dev who actually reads a review for once this specific thing happened to me in my first few games as killer)
End remarks: Unless you are re buying this game don't waste your time on it, matchmaking is unbalanced and 99% of games are gonna be people that would call you a bot/paid actor in their yt video

You must level up each individual survivor and killer. So, overall its very time consuming yet enjoyable with all the things you need to do to feel somewhat accomplished.

Ideal for people who like nature and camping & tunnels

De los pocos asimétricos que "sobreviven" y sin duda de los mejores. Se le puede echar muchísimas horas. Hay un montón de personajes de los que aprender a jugar y dominar, cada uno con sus habilidades y modificadores. Variedad de mapas con ambientes totalmente distintos que hacen que cada partida se disfrute como si fuera única.
Los desarrolladores siguen sacando actualizaciones para todos los jugadores y contenido nuevo a través de DLCs (asesinos, supervivientes y mapas). Los mapas son para todo el mundo, y cualquier personaje se puede acabar comprando con dinero del juego que se obtiene por progresar la cuenta (a excpeción de los DLCs con licencia, por ejemplo "Nightmare" y "Ghost Face").

Purchase this game and any DLC in question when they are on sale (happens fairly often). As for the game itself? Fun as hell, easy to waste time match by match. It will frustrate you sometimes but that's just the way it goes with semi-competitive games. The devs are doing better than they have in the past, and the game has problems but with each update/ dev letter I feel like they listen a bit more and work a bit harder. With the new progression / prestige system (expected to release in the live game August of 2022,) I highly recommend new players and returning players who gave up to try again, the grind for unlocks will be vastly reduced, meaning more access to players, it is a great time to get into or back into dead by daylight.

Now to list off things I like and don't like in no particular order:

+ The game has a very unique learning curve and room for skillful play. Both killer and survivors have many levels and layers of mechanical skill, player knowledge, and mindgame potential. 

- The concept of "winning" is vague in DBD, and therefore certain play styles are more effective than others. Specifically, killers with low IQ may opt to "camp" or "tunnel" survivor players in their matches to guarantee kills, instead of earning them through chase. This is not fun for most people, including the killer whether they think so or not. Unfortunately, the devs have done very little to discourage killers from playing this way.

+ Variety of content is huge. Player builds continue to expand with each chapter and keep the game interesting. Players with over 1000 hours likely have not encountered every perk interaction, combo, on every killer or survivor on every map. This keeps the game interesting and replayable.

- Like all online play games, a meta exists in DBD, and the devs are aware of the meta, but as of the most recent PTB, the devs aimed to rework perks to shake up the meta. It is obvious they know the problems that meta play has, and what needs to change, but with the current state of PTB, I don't feel like they accomplished their goals.

开始打的时候可能会不适应，不过简单易上手，基本操作大概打7-10把就熟悉了，这时候可能会说有走捷径的想法，很正常，其实打血点挺简单，一定要扎实打，不至于毛手高配。
然后，作为恐怖游戏，其实不算恐怖，练熟了以后大概是：跟跑模拟器---低血压治疗器-----群殴模拟器---门口大爷转正留守儿童模拟器
在这里面可能不是因为溅血恐怖，可能是因为害怕重击前突吃板
不过作为我最喜欢的游戏，屠夫开宰的手感没得说，我觉得很刺激；被追的时候确实会紧张。
（虽然看视频里面有很多叮当飞天。。。。。）
总体还是值得入手！【量力而行，不要逞强哦】

considering the hours I've invested, this game makes top 5 favourite. There is much satisfaction from running from a killer and attempting an escape while working as a team. sometimes I'll sacrifice myself for others to save them last minute which is very amusing. Also being the killer is entertaining, whether the team your killing are total noobs or pro's . Catching them and putting them on a hook fullfilll's that dark demented part of your soul.
Although many of the folks your playing with being that its online are routinely negative and quiters, or they help the killer and sabotage the team. This part of the game genuinely wrecks it for me and because of this I hardly play anymore. The best horror game ever, with the right team!
